name: places/ChIJ6UxTIOlYwokRhliLwIcoi54
adrFormatAddress: 1103 3rd Ave, New York, NY 10065, USA

editorialSummary.text: Retailer providing wireless plans & a range of phones, devices & accessories.

originalText.text: Jess and Fernando were truly knowledgeable, attentive and got the job done. It was a transfer of an existing number over to AT&T and a change of plan. They went above and beyond, and even though it took some time, they were very amenable and nice to work with. A day after, I encountered a minor issue and decided to stopped by the store instead of calling AT&T’s Customer Service number. They were, once again, fast, effective and very pleasant to be around. I highly recommend this store. Thanks guys!

text.text: Jess and Fernando were truly knowledgeable, attentive and got the job done. It was a transfer of an existing number over to AT&T and a change of plan. They went above and beyond, and even though it took some time, they were very amenable and nice to work with. I highly recommend this store. Thanks guys!

originalText.text: Don’t recommend upgrading with ATT service. Had a horrible iPhone upgrade experience. Phones are locked down in store so you can’t hold. I decided to return iPhone 15 pro for max after going to Apple Store. The store processed return incorrectly and didn’t reverse my upgrade. So I couldn’t upgrade to new phone and was making installment payments on a phone that I do not have. It took 3 weeks and hours of ATT runaround to fix their mistake but I missed the higher trade in value by that time. I will switch provider after this waste of time and money. Upgrading essentially traps you to any provider service, recommend buying phone upfront without commitment if possible.

originalText.text: Janelle and Cat helped us with a complicated order and they were both fantastic! Knew their stuff and were professional yet friendly. We upgraded our account and got 2 new iPhones, some accessories and Directv trial. Can't say enough good things about Janelle and Cat except they should both get raises!

text.text: Janelle and Cat helped us with a complicated order and they were both fantastic! Knew their stuff and were professional yet friendly. We upgraded our account and got 2 new iPhones, some accessories and Directv trial. Can't say enough good things about Janelle and Cat except they should both get raises!

originalText.text: Upon entering store, both associates were sitting down and staring at their tablets at the front of store seemingly paying no attention to walk-ins. I began browsing for an item only to be approached by the security guard. He asked if I needed help finding what I was looking for and kept insisting I ask an associate for help. I replied multiple times "I'm ok I know what I'm looking for ". After insisting a 3rd time I asked if a specific phone case can be ordered. To which I received " no sorry " as a reply while tapping her tablet screen. I've been in retail for a long time and I know that most corporate locations. Want you to engage your customers the moment they walk through the door. Why it took over 2 minutes for anyone to engage me at all when the store was empty is beyond me. Even more puzzling is why security was the first to engage me. That was the worst customer service I have ever experienced at an AT&T location

originalText.text: Bunty G, was very helpful throughout my entire process of ordering and setting up my phone. He communicated each step and requirement to me, and was very attentive and understating to my wants/needs for my new device. I greatly appreciated his assistance, it made my experience pleasurable. I would recommend this specific at&t store and Bunty G to anyone.
